content.p: If you are reading this, then you are here to learn more about the human body. Think of this course as your “user manual”. You will have an opportunity to more thoroughly learn about the anatomy and physiology of your body. An understanding of human A&P is essential for any career in health care.

Before you begin on this journey let’s take a few minutes and see what your understanding is now. There are many common misconceptions about human anatomy and physiology, and there are many reasons you might know facts about the human body. Let’s see how you do!

body.p: Fingernails and hair continue to grow after death.

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is a myth. After death the skin shrinks which can give the appearance of longer hair and nails, but there is no cell growth after death.

Correct. Tissue grows because cells multiply. This process requires cellular energy (ATP), and once death occurs there is no ATP available for this process. After death the skin shrinks which gives the appearance of longer hair and nails.

body.p: Warts can be caught from toads.

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is a myth. Warts are caused by a virus and spread from people who have the virus or warts and even inanimate objects they may touch, not a toad!
Correct. A virus cause warts and the human specific virus is not spread between different species, such as a toad and a human.

body.p: Going outside in cold, wet, weather will cause you to catch a cold.

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is a myth. A cold is caused by a virus not by cold weather.
Correct. There isn’t any evidence that being in cold wet weather increases your risk of catching a cold. Colds are caused by the rhinovirus not the weather.

body.p: We only use about 10% of our brain.

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is a myth. While we don’t use all of our brain at one time, brain research and imaging shows that damage to any part of the brain will have an effect and inactive neurons are also important.
Correct. This myth developed from overgeneralization of a psychology theory before brain imaging techniques allowed us to really understand how different parts of the brain work at different times.

body.p: The liver and spleen can regenerate.

feedback.p: Correct. Some organs in the human body have the ability to repair and regenerate when damaged. This is limited and related to the major type of tissue in that organ. Excessive damage can destroy any organ.
Incorrect. This one is a fact! Organs with mainly epithelial and connective tissue and even smooth muscle are able to repair because those tissues have cells able to divide and repair tissue damage.

body.p: Cracking your knuckles will cause arthritis.

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is a myth. Repetitive knuckle cracking might eventually weaken the joints, though it does not cause arthritis.
Correct. Cracking knuckles is the sound of gas bubbles and does not cause arthritis. Arthritis is a group of inflammatory conditions and can be caused by aging or pathological events at the joint.

body.p: Women have a better sense of smell than men.

feedback.p: Correct. This one is true. Numerous studies have demonstrated that women have a more sensitive sense of smell.
Incorrect. This one is a fact! Women are better able to identify smells than men. This ability continues throughout life and may be linked to female hormones.

body.p: Humans can survive longer without food than sleep.

feedback.p: Correct. Humans can go months without food but only a few days without sleep.
Incorrect. This one is a fact! Humans need sleep and will suffer the effects of missed sleep in only a few days, while we can go months without food.

body.p: The width of your arm span is equal to your height.

feedback.p: Correct. This is true for most people, try it!
Incorrect. This one is true (for most people)! Your arm span is the same as your height.

Correct. Many studies have shown that consuming sugar in any form does not affect children’s behavior, but if a parent thought their child was given sugar they perceived their child as being hyperactive.
